intro: Cyrtanthus rhododactylus, commonly known as the rock lily, is a bulbous perennial plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllis family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are strap-like and evergreen, often persisting through winter. Cyrtanthus rhododactylus is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to bloom reliably in suitable climates.
